description.narrative: GGR grant will support continued dialogues regarding climate change and food security with residents of 12 villages in Sunderban (the area declared by the government as the most affected by climate change) and encourage community based groups to take actions to address the problems they are facing and advocate for eco friendly governmental policies. In collaboration with local community based organizations, the activistsl will run a public awareness and educational campaign translating relevant reports and materials into local language and organizing dialogues with government officials at the local and state level. The group plans to hold a workshop for media workers to provide them with information and tools to share the stories of people affected by climate change, and community strategies for climate change adaptation and mitigation. The activists hope that their advocacy work will prompt policy makers to take initiatives to draft appropriate policies for climate change and its victims in Sunderban and other regions.
